text: Polyploca korbi is a moth in the family Drepanidae. It is found in Turkey and on the Greek island of Samos. The wingspan is 29.5–33 mm.Ann. Hofmus. Wien. 16 : 167 The larvae feed on Quercus pubescens and Quercus infectoria. They can be found in April and May. ==Etymology== The species is named for Max Korb, who first discovered the species.lepiforum.de ==References== Category:Moths described in 1901 Category:Thyatirinae Category:Moths of Turkey Category:Moths of Europe
title: Polyploca korbi
